text: President Trump's physician, Dr. Sean Conley, told reporters on Saturday morning that Trump was "doing very well." But an official identified as chief of staff Mark Meadows gave a different account.
Transcript: President Trump's Doctors Provide Saturday Update On His Health
Trump Gives Video Update On His Health: Next Couple Days Are 'The Real Test'
Timeline: What We Know Of President Trump's COVID-19 Diagnosis
How Do You Contact Trace The President Of The United States?
President Trump's physician said late Friday evening that he is "doing very well" at Walter Reed National Military Medical Center and has started Remdesivir therapy.
Trump Is Taking Remdesivir. Here's How It Works To Control The Coronavirus
Congress saw its first two members enter self-quarantine on March 8. Later that month, seven members tested positive or were presumed so and dozens more were quarantined. The ranks have since grown.
2 Republican Senators Test Positive For Coronavirus After Trump
Pence carried on with his usual schedule on Friday, even as a number of prominent Republicans revealed COVID-19 diagnoses on Friday.
The state's Supreme Court said Gov. Gretchen Whitmer lacked the authority to extend a state of emergency past April 30. Whitmer had cited two state laws in extending her emergency declarations.
Pete Buttigieg argues that Americans don't trust enough — in the government and in each other. Buttigieg talks with NPR about his book, Trust: America's Best Chance.
It would be "very difficult" to pull President Trump's name from the November ballot, says John Fortier, who led the Continuity of Government Commission. But that's just one hypothetical.
What Happens If The President Is Incapacitated? The 25th Amendment Charts A Course
They are working to contact those who had been in close proximity to the president, the first lady and others who traveled with him in recent days to get tested.
President Trump relentlessly interrupted his opponent Joe Biden, who responded at times with personal insults. That event stands in contrast to recent debates with women presidential candidates.
A U.S. military court judge who took over the 9/11 case two weeks ago has quit. That means a 9/11 trial is unlikely to begin by the 20th anniversary of the Sept. 11, 2001, attacks.
The recording could answer lingering questions about how prosecutors have handled a case that has fueled protests in Kentucky and across the nation.
A federal judge has ordered the Census Bureau to keep counting households for now after finding the agency violated an earlier order by tweeting a "target" end date of Oct. 5.

Women left jobs at four times the rate of men in September. The burden of parenting and running a household while also working a job has created a pressure cooker environment that's pushing women out.
'This Is Too Much': Working Moms Are Reaching The Breaking Point During The Pandemic
In a blog post, the social media giant said it would review how preview images are cropped after some users recently posted examples white faces being selected over Black faces.
NPR's Scott Simon talks about Piotr Cywinski of the Auschwitz-Birkenau Memorial. He suggested Nigeria's president allow 120 adults to each serve a month of a boy's 10-year prison sentence.
The former movie producer now faces 11 sex crime charges in Los Angeles. He is currently serving a 23-year sentence in New York.
Here is a sampling of what the president has said and when, including that time he said a "miracle" might make the pandemic "disappear."
All three tech companies confirmed that posts expressing the hope that the president does not recover from COVID-19 will be removed for violating each platform's content policies.
Daniel Prude Death: Rochester, N.Y., Mayor Fires Police Chief, Seeks Federal Inquiries
Online voting for the fattest bear at Katmai National Park is on, as the chunks race to get big before hibernation.
Critic Jason Sheehan says the new novel from Matt Haig — about a mystical library that lets people sample all the ways their lives might have gone — is a little too gentle and straightforward.

Fall is the time for glossy fashion magazines, full of dazzling looks and the seasons hottest looks. But this year, we noticed something unusual: The covers of a bunch of major magazines fashion magazines featured Black folks. So we called up fashion critic Robin Givhan to talk about fashion's racial reckoning — and how long before it goes out of style.
Darren Star, who created Younger and Sex And The City, has a new show on Netflix about a young woman who heads to France for the job of her dreams.
The president also said that he chose to go to Walter Reed medical center rather than be "locked up in a room upstairs" in the White House. He said he is feeling better than when he arrived Friday.
White House Official Calls Next 48 Hours 'Critical' For Trump's Care
Pence Working From Home For Now But Plans To Travel On Monday

A federal judge has ordered the Census Bureau to keep counting households for now after finding the agency violated an earlier order by tweeting a "target" end date of Oct. 5.

Women left jobs at four times the rate of men in September. The burden of parenting and running a household while also working a job has created a pressure cooker environment that's pushing women out.
'This Is Too Much': Working Moms Are Reaching The Breaking Point During The Pandemic
The former movie producer now faces 11 sex crime charges in Los Angeles. He is currently serving a 23-year sentence in New York.
Here is a sampling of what the president has said and when, including that time he said a "miracle" might make the pandemic "disappear."
All three tech companies confirmed that posts expressing the hope that the president does not recover from COVID-19 will be removed for violating each platform's content policies.
Critic Jason Sheehan says the new novel from Matt Haig — about a mystical library that lets people sample all the ways their lives might have gone — is a little too gentle and straightforward.

Fall is the time for glossy fashion magazines, full of dazzling looks and the seasons hottest looks. But this year, we noticed something unusual: The covers of a bunch of major magazines fashion magazines featured Black folks. So we called up fashion critic Robin Givhan to talk about fashion's racial reckoning — and how long before it goes out of style.
Darren Star, who created Younger and Sex And The City, has a new show on Netflix about a young woman who heads to France for the job of her dreams.
The president also said that he chose to go to Walter Reed medical center rather than be "locked up in a room upstairs" in the White House. He said he is feeling better than when he arrived Friday.

President Trump first tweeted that he had tested positive for the coronavirus early Friday morning. But questions remain about what exactly happened before and after.
The President's diagnosis calls for contact tracing on a massive scale. Luckily, not everyone President Trump saw this week with is a high risk exposure. Here's who is.
